result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha S. Lawson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10% modified to zero.  Cash bond paid restitution in full.

Defendant Samantha S. Lawson in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton gives status of agreement.   Plea to Count 2 & 3.  Dismiss/read in Count 1.  State agrees as noted.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Attorney Middleton gives final statement.  Victim rights met.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 2 & 3:
2 years Probation x 2, concurrent
Provide DNA sample
Undergo any counseling per agent.
$500.00 Restitution with 10% Surcharge 
$243.00 x 2 and $200.00 DNA x 2 & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Cash bond to be applied to restitution
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Samantha S. Lawson in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Middleton believes matter will be resolved.  Needs short reset to meet w/DE one more time.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Melville Peter Middleton in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Need a short adjournment, misunderstood date.  Bond continues  Return date scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 07-17-2015 10:30 am.
Return date at 08-06-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Samantha S. Lawson in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton just received the case.  Request PTC/RD.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Return date scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 06-19-2015 09:30 am.
Return date at 07-01-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Samantha S. Lawson appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Puck Tsai. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin and intern Rick Spoentgen.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney. State requests $500 Cash bond.   Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $500.00 Cash bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Return date scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
